Title: 18 Again
Review: Beginning was a little too much of a direct copy from the American movie but then it diverges nicely. Lee do hyun really carries this show and I mostly watched it for him. Overall it’s really wholesome. Happy ending. A couple boring parts and could have been 12 eps but a pleasant watch overall.

Title: A Good Day to Be a Dog
Review: i really liked this show at the beginning. the story line of them falling in love and her hiding her secret was all really fun and cute. but then the second half of the show pivoted to be about their past lives and the mountain god’s revenge plot and it lost me. the entire revenge ended up being a misunder which was just annoying. i ffw through some parts at the end. it felt like two different shows. had a few good kiss scenes tho.

Title: A Killer Paradox
Review: Started off strong, but then the focus shifted away from the main character to the detective and the other killer. it started to feel rushed like they were putting too much content into eight episodes. seems like they set it up for a second season, which i would probably watch because i like the main actor, but this drama wasn’t anything to write home about.

Title: A Love So Beautiful
Review: Way too cheesy and all the characters are too childish and immature for me to be invested in them. Theme song was kinda catchy tho lol.

Title: A Time Called You
Review:
GAY SUBPLOT BETWEEN AHN HYO SEOP AND ROWOON?? i was shooketh.
that alone makes this a memorable
drama lol. but that aside, the story is really interesting and this was binge
material for sure. ahn hyeo seop was so cute in it, and the female lead had incredible range playing two diff characters. the time travel logic definitely needed work, and the ending didnt make a ton of sense (for ex: if the casette player and tape was destroyed in 1998, then why does jun-hee have it in the future?) but the focus was more on the romance and “destiny” than on the mechanics of time travel. id give anything for a rowoon/ahn hyo seop gay spin off tho!!!

Title: A Virtuous Business
Review:
a funny and sweet show full of friendship and female empowerment. loved the sex positivity and the 90s nostalgia. the friendship of the four main women was so heartwarming and seeing them support each other through thick and thin was really sweet. the romance between the FL and ML was also sweet and i liked that it wasnt the main focus of the show. there is a cold case mystery plot but this really was more of a slice of life comedy with some melodrama thrown in. the ending was a little
bit abrupt but i think 16 episodes could have dragged so im overall satisfied.

Title: Alchemy of Souls
Review: Some major highs and lows. Love the main couple and it’s an interesting story and has good world building. But some of the writing/plot is pretty bad and the ending was badly written and very deus ex machina. Fun watch tho. Will watch the second part.

Title: Alchemy of Souls Season 2: Light and Shadow
Review: Didn’t love the second season. A lot of the charm of s1 was missing. I missed Somin as the FL. The scene with Kim Doju and Park Jin was a major tearjerker, but glad that the season had a happy ending for everyone. Also had some very good kisses.

Title: All of Us Are Dead
Review: Some bright moments, but overall this drama was just okay. The dialogue and acting of the kids kind of felt flat for me and I wasn’t attached to any of them. But did have some good cliffhangers and action to keep me watching and I teared up at a couple moments.

Title: Be Melodramatic
Review:
This drama is so special. Every character has so much depth and is delightfully weird and complicated. Each relationship, even the side couples, is interesting and compelling in their own way. The main couple is surprisingly sweet and has a lot of chemistry. It might be one of my favorite romances ever. It was delightfully slow burn, but with depth and cuteness and humor. Gave me fanny flutters for sure.

The oppa scene made me laugh so hard. The whole fart episode was so funny. So many scenes made me cry. It’s so relatable but also so meta and and the plot truly kept me guessing the whole time. Each episode I was just along for this delightful, odd, heartwarming ride. 

The kiss scenes for the actress/manager couple were also fire and the OST was so good. A slow start at the beginning, and I initially dropped it, but I’m so glad I gave this drama another chance.

Title: Because This Is My First Life
Review: Good example of a trope done well. Like that it centers around women. Has some hilarious moments. Good romance and kiss scenes. Like the odd couple dynamic of the leads. Didn’t love the third couple they were kind of annoying

Title: Bloodhounds
Review: Plot left something to be desired, and ended quite abruptly. Would have liked more character and plot development. Also super brutal when the grandpa and his two guys were killed off. But LOVED the main two actors and their friendship. Watching them beat up a bunch of criminals was quite satisfying….also the younger one is adorable and very good looking.

Title: Brewing Love
Review: I went into this drama not knowing what to expext because the description was weird but I was very pleasantly surprised. The male lead might be the greenest flag ever written in a kdrama. I really enjoyed the aspects of him being an empath and being able to sense other people’s emotions. There were some really raw emotional scenes in this drama. There were also some very sweet slice of life ensemble cast elements to this drama too. Overall I liked both couple romances, though I wish there was a bit more cute time spent focusing on relationship development and cuteness and a little less on the plot surrounding the beer product launch. However, there were some good workplace plot lines in there (and anti-capitalist/pro-worker themes) that I appreciated. A fun main OST song too. Also, the male lead is very pretty. Overall a fun watch with a more healing, slow pace but enough cute moments to keep you invested.

Title: Business Proposal
Review: One of the best rom coms I’ve ever watched. Chemistry between both couples is 10/10. Made me literally LOL. No stupid plot points, just pure fun and satisfaction. Sad it ended.

Title: Castaway Diva
Review: started off really strong - the first 1-2 episodes especially. but it got kind of boring in the middle/end and i found myself fast forwarding a good amount. sometimes i fast forwarded just to find out what would happen. but this did have some bright spots - the main male lead is very sweet. the female lead is interesting but kind of annoying at times. the scenes with her singing on stage were great though. had a wholesome ending which i appreciated. good kiss scene between the leads too but i wish theyd had more cute couple scenes. the emphasis was not on romance though - it was more on self discovery and family.

Title: Celebrity
Review: interesting commentary on social media and influencer culture. started off a tad boring but quickly became super interesting. could be very dramatic at times but was a fun, interesting watch with lots of twists near the end. also loved the junho cameo at the end (even though it was kinda confusing)

Title: Cheer Up
Review: Extremely wholesome show. Some parts made me tear up and smile so much. A bit too much melodrama at times, didn’t love the love triangle. Fast forwarded the scenes with the old couple bc they were boring. Lots of other cute side couples though. And a really wholesome sweet ending.

Title: Cheese in the Trap
Review: So bad. So much stalking and violence against women. Male lead is a sociopath and does wrong every episode yet FL stays with him DESPITE the fact that she initially in episode one sees through him and knows he’s manipulative. ML is never held accountable literally throughout the whole series. College drama is boring. All characters suck except for SML who is the only redeeming part of this drama

Title: Chicken Nugget
Review: Plot is utterly ridiculous but oddly heartwarming. I was surprised that this show actually make me tear up on multiple occasions. Also very funny, plus had some good social commentary. All the actors were great too. Definitely an offbeat, quirky show but it was very fun to watch.

Title: Cinderella and the Four Knights
Review: Has its cute moments but a bit too cheesy and tropey. Nothing stand out but I didn’t want to drop it.

Title: Cinderella at 2 AM
Review:
started off very cute with an interesting premise but then the premise got kind of old after a while. the first 6-8 episodes are basically the main couple having the same conversation about whether or
not to break up over and over again. i did like the male lead a lot and the second couple was surprisingly cute, but the rest of the side characters were annoying. overall it had cute moments, good kiss scenes, and a fun OST but was just your average romcom kdrama.

Title: Crash Course in Romance
Review: Started off really really strong but eventually it totally missed the mark. Marketed itself as romance but was actually about mental health and suicide, with a murder plot. But then it transitioned back to fluffy romance at the end in a way that felt completely jarring and tone deaf. Could have been a lot better but was just average for me.

Title: Crash Landing on You
Review: Another drama that has it all - romance, humor, action, tears, and a great ensemble cast. The kdrama that truly made me fall in love with kdramas.

Title: D.P.
Review: Underrated drama. Brilliant acting with an interesting story. Loved the diff vignettes of the defected soldiers. Jung hae in and his co lead are great. Could be a bit boring at times.

Title: D.P. Season 2
Review: Very well done drama, a good continuation of season 1. Jung hae in is always great, his co-lead lost a bit of his charm in s2 (but was dealing eith PTSD). Ending was sad in that nothing really changed but it felt realistic. Season 1 was probably better but this was still good.

Title: Dali and the Cocky Prince
Review: Cute romance, some funny moments, but the plot got too melodramatic most of the time. I wish there was more romance and less about the plot. Good kiss scenes tho! And an implied sex scene that was well done too

Title: Death's Game
Review: There was a lot of hype around this show and I finally got around to watching it. I was especially excited about the all star cast and the rotating roster of cameos. But it was a huge letdown and was highly over-rated. It felt like a very heavy handed PSA against suicide without any real or nuanced deep dive into mental health or depression. And then it went from survival game to revenge plot, and all the twists became a bit too convenient toward the later episodes. Plus, there were major plot holes like why some reincarnations were not linear and why the main character did not change his fate during the 11th reincarnation when he was in the body of the man who ran into traffic on his interview day, setting off the initial chain of events. That made no sense, since Death told him he couldnt kill himself, but he literally did as that man. This drama falls into the same bucket as Squid Game — overly hyped action/thriller/horror drama on a major streaming platform that isn’t actually that original but follows a more ‘western’ TV formula that means it’ll probably end up being a crowd pleaser.

Title: Destined with You
Review: writing/plot had some major issues and holes here and there but ROWOON IS SO ADORABLE. he reallt hit his stride in this. the beginning episodes where he’s under the love spell are particularly adorable. also, this drama had one of the steamiest and most well doje sex scenes ive seen in kdramas. i will say, some of the side character plots felt useless and boring like with the mom/dad/lawyer and the orher office romance. overall its a fun watch.

Title: Do You Like Brahms?
Review: Good kiss scenes. But super melodramatic and boring. Lots of dumb couple miscommunication. Main leads are boring. Whole plot is boring. Fast forwarded through the last few eps bc I didn’t care anymore.

Title: Doctor Cha
Review: Started off really good but I got a bit annoyed with how everyone lies to her and Dr. Cha is so apologetic all the time…having said that, had some hilarious moments especially in the beginning and middle. Happy ending.

Title: Doctor Slump
Review: such a beautiful, heartwarming, healing drama. the male lead is amazing — one of my favorite actors. he does romantic comedy so well. the female lead was also good — she was relatable and i was rooting for her throughout the drama. the ensemble cast, including the second couple and the family, were also great. i loved that the show dealt honestly with mental health. the drama made me laugh and also cry. after finishing i was so emotional and cried happy tears. nice ending. a drama ill be thinking about for a while.

Title: Doona!
Review: this reminded me of something in the rain: very romantic, couple has chemistry but is slightly more toxic than SITR, life gets in the way of their relationship, ambiguous open ended ending. Some of the cinematography is beautiful. The kiss/sex/emotional love confession scenes are very well done. the leads are good. bur a lot if underdeveloped and the plot suffers from classic kdrama character miscommunication. i mean, did doona really expect wonjun to be totally fine after she made a comeback and literally went radio silent for however long? so she was hella frustrating for sure. but at the same time, their scenes together did give me the feels and the male lead made me shed a tear. i wish it had been a happier ending, tho it wasnt a totally sad one.

Title: Dreaming of a Freaking Fairytale
Review: Binged this show in a week. I actually really enjoyed it. It was short, and kind of cliche, but well executed with good chemistry, steamy kisses, some laugh out loud moments, and good acting. overall just a fun and enjoyable watch.

Title: Extracurricular
Review: Wow. Super fast paced interesting story. Pretty tragic. Main leads acting is really good. Suspenseful. This was a binge watch for sure.

Title: Extraordinary Attorney Woo
Review: Super cute wholesome heartwarming show. Some plots kind of annoying like with the dick lawyer and some of the cases iffy. But overall great and great ensemble cast

Title: Extraordinary You
Review: The drama that made me fall in love with Rowoon. Clever story and writing. Good cast. Dragged a little bit here and there.

Title: Family by Choice
Review: A very wholesome family drama with all the feels and so many tears. I really loved how the show approached the idea of chosen family. It definitely leaned heavily on melodrama and had some terrible characters, like Sanha’s mother, but it also had really warm characters that you could root for, some very genuine emotional scenes, and some really good acting. Both main couples were cute, and the relationship between the three main leads is very fun and their relationship with their dads is really sweet. It was wrapped up perhaps a bit too neatly at the end, but for all the trauma these characters were put through, I’m not mad about the simple happy ending.

Title: Flex X Cop
Review: decently entertaining drama. it started off very fun and i liked that there were different cases the team worked on. it kept things interesting instead of just having one plot. however, with the family drama storyline i think there were too many twists, but at the same time it was predictable that his brother turned out to be a bady guy. i also would have liked to see more romance between the two main leads (or even the second couple) to keep things interesting.

Title: Flower of Evil
Review: This is a REALLY good drama. Super interesting plot and the male lead’s acting is SO GOOD. The FL’s acting is a little basic and she makes like the same 5 faces the whole time. Kid in this is so adorable. Occasionally the cat and mouse game got a tad tiring but overall great story and ending. Love that it’s really a love story hidden in a thriller/suspense story.

Title: Gaus Electronics
Review: Very cute romance and super hilarious, but a couple of sus slightly racist parts. Liked that at least Aziz was incorporated as a full character and not just ornamental.

Title: Goblin
Review: A total classic. LOVE THE SECOND COUPLE SO MUCH. The main couple is a bit creepy bc of the age difference so that was hard to get past. A bit boring in the beginning. But by the end loved it. Felt the feels for sure. “A beautiful life” is such a good OST song.

Title: Good Job
Review: Funny and cute show, very enjoyable. The mystery was a bit basic. Would def watch a s2 where they solve a diff case each day rather than one long one.

Title: Happiness
Review: I was a bit torn on this one bc on one hand I kind of thought it was over hyped. But then once I finished it I couldn’t stop thinking about it and upon further reflection it’s actually really well done. Very suspenseful, has twists and turns, romance and action. Liked the message that the humans were actually the real monsters not the infected. Didn’t love the FL as an actress but liked that she was a strong female lead. Loved the ML. Liked that they saved and helped each other and that the woman wasn’t always the damsel in distress.

Title: Healer
Review: Slightly cheesy since it’s an older drama but the plot and the romance are great. Action packed. A bit melodramatic but loved it.

Title: Heartbeat
Review:
Started off fun, then got boring, then got kind of cute, but then got super melodramatic. was hoping for a twist ending where he lived, but he died in the end which was unsatisfying. had some bright spots but felt the urge to fast forward toward the end of the series. taecyon was good in it tho (and super cute). didnt love the female lead (or SFL
or SML either lol)

Title: Her Private Life
Review: Obvi love the plot bc being a fan girl is close to my heart lol. Probably my favorite park min young drama tho I don’t love the leads that much. A fun watch but not the most memorable.

Title: Hierarchy
Review: this has to be one of the worst kdramas i have ever watched. the plot was so poorly written and predictable. it felt like a bad american melodrama. it tried fo be edgy but the actinf was just lackluster and awkward. none of the characters were charming and i couldnt even root for the male lead because he made dumb choices. the female lead has has ao much plastic surgery and was frighteningly thin and her acting was robotic. the only good thing about this drama was that it was only 7 episodes.

Title: Hometown Cha-Cha-Cha
Review: This is a fantastic slice of life romcom. Great ensemble cast - reminded me of CLOY in that way. Love that it’s set outside of Seoul. There was a bit of conflict here and there with the main couple but nothing annoying like a breakup or time jump. Cute and satisfying happy ending. Love triangle a bit unnecessary. Overall very heartwarming and cute drama. Would rewatch. Also super funny!

Title: Into the Ring
Review: Quirky, fun drama. SUPER GOOD KISS SCENES! Like, they actually move their lips. Romance is cute and sweet. Main female lead could be slightly annoying at times. But loved all the strong female leads in this overall. The male lead was very good at acting - it was weird to see him in this role after seeing him as the bad guy in the glory but I got over that quickly lol. An all around good drama.

Title: It's Okay to Not Be Okay
Review: Kind of overrated. The brother is great. The FL is kind of refreshing bc she’s so blunt and outspoken but also kind of annoying. Dragged a bit. Not something I have a desire to rewatch really

Title: Itaewon Class
Review: I liked the representation in this and the first few eps are good. FL and SFL are terribly annoying and couldn’t see past this. Also v cheesy and dramatic most of the time. And PSJ’s hair does not do him any favors.

Title: Just Between Lovers
Review: Made me cry so many times, so glad it had a happy ending, loved the leads, great acting, ending felt rushed and there was a bit too much breaking up between the leads

Title: King the Land
Review: super cute adorable romcom (in the same league as business proposal). the part with the saudi prince was a tad sus and some of the family drama was a bit meh, but besides that the drama had a great cast, adorable couple moments, a cute second couple, a great OST, and a cute ending. junho is so damn attractive and adorable in this one.

Title: Kiss Sixth Sense
Review: Had some cute and also steamy couple moments and seemed promising at the beginning but overall the show wasn’t great. The second lead characters were annoying, the backstory ended up being kind of cliche, and the ending with all the fighting and breaking up was not cute. A couple of episodes in the middle were cute when they were sneaking around the office. There were bright moments but not a standout show by any means.

Title: Light on Me
Review: Very cute. Love triangle is done well in that I loved both love interests and did not know which one the main lead would choose. But it’s a short series and the plot moves fast and I wish there had been more cute moments and more depth to the characters storylines backgrounds and motivations. Very adorable miniseries tho

Title: Like Flowers in Sand
Review: What a beautiful drama. So wholesome. made me laugh and made me cry. the acting of the main leads is SO GOOD. Kim Baek Doo is so pure and adorable and will go down in history as one of my favorite kdrama characters of all time. the main actor completely owned the role. the female lead is also fantastic. the ssireum wrestling and the murder plot were essential to the story but didnt overwhelm it. it was the romance and friendship that really shined through. only complaint is that it could have been 16 episodes and then we could have gotten more cute couple scenes post-love-confession but the 12 episode narrative was done well and they stuck the landing.

Title: Link: Eat, Love, Kill
Review: Very solid drama. ML is incredible - his acting is just so good and he’s especially good at the emotional scenes. A few scenes in this drama made me bawl. There w was a mix of suspense, sadness, cuteness and humor in this drama. Sometimes the switching between these moods was a little jarring but overall it worked. Could have been an amazing drama if they leaned all the way in to drama and made it more like my mister but it still had romantic comedy elements. Overall enjoyable.

Title: Love All Play
Review: Best love story, chemistry, and male lead I’ve seen in a while. I laughed and I cried. Got a bit melodramatic in the middle but overall this is a kdrama that gave me ALL the feels. Park Taeyang and Park Taejun are the cutest ahhhhhhhh

Title: Love Is for Suckers
Review: Started off interesting. I was super intrigued by the reality dating show plot esp since the FL is a commentator on singles inferno. The backstory of the ML was super emotional and I was into it for a while. But the plot reaaaally dragged in the middle to end and I ended up fast forwarding to see what happens bc I was so I engaged by the end. I loved the side couple of John Jang and the webtoon artist tho - they were adorable and that’s the first love plot I’ve seen for a female actress who’s a bit “heavier” and not your typical love interest.

Title: Love Next Door
Review: This drama was a bit of a rollercoaster in that it had major ups and downs. started off great — very cute and intruiging given its amazing cast. i was especially excited to see the two main actors in a couple together since i love them both. but then it went downhill in the middle and did not rebound until the last 4-5 episodes which were pretty much just a return to cute fluff, plus some heartwarming family moments. having said all that, this drama had some very very sweet couples scenes — especially the kiss scene in the sunflower field and the proposal scenes — and some character and family moments that made me cry. It had a nice satisfying ending so im glad i watched it in the end but it was a bit overhyped overall.

Title: Love to Hate You
Review: Started off weird but ended up liking it. Female lead is fun and sex/kissing scenes are really good. Nice ending. Overall cute/funny romcom.

Title: Love Your Enemy
Review: Overall a cute drama with some funny moments. The main highlights were the teenage flashbacks of the main couple’s love story, and the lead up to then dating after they reuinted as adults. However, this is one of those romantic comedy kdramas that suffers from some classic pitfalls. For one, it adds a completely unnecessary evil uncle embezzlement/indirect murder plot that was so pointless and kind of ruined the tone of the drama. Secondly, it got very boring after the main couple actually got together, which can happen in a lot of dramas. The tension and entertainment revolved around the will-they-wont-they aspect of the plot, and once they actually did get together, there was not enough chemsitry nor cute couple moments. Finally, the ensemble cast and side plots were not that strong. I did kind of like the nurse and teacher couple by the end, but there really were no standout side characters and in fact many of them were quite annoying like the sabotaging best friend, male lead’s dad, and gossiping teacher. The drama did have some sweet moments and a few really good OST songs though.

Title: Lovely Runner
Review: A really good romantic drama with all the feels. The two main leads have great chemistry and the kiss scenes are top notch. The time travel is filled with plot holes but you can easily get over that because the characters and love story is super good. Lots of cute moments, and it was fun to see the couple fall in love multiple times. The male lead is officially one of my favorites — he was so good in this drama and he plays the smitten boyfriend so well. Also he’s beautiful.

Title: Lovestruck in the City
Review: I love the male lead but the show wasn’t really long or developed enough for me to care enough about the characters. Entertaining and had clever elements with the mockumentary but not amazing

Title: Marry My Husband
Review: very satisfying revenge story. the villains were great - you really love to hate them. main couple has good chemistry and is cute. side characters cute. the plot went a bit sideways near the end with the introduction of thr ex-fiance but had a satisfying ending, plus some time to wrap things up nicely.

Title: Melancholia
Review: I love this ML. His acting is so good. The principal was a total love to hate character and she was great at playing the villain. The subtle and slow progressing romance was well done and didn’t feel creepy. The math stuff could get a bit tedious at times. I think if I binged this I would have gotten a bit bored but I liked watching it while airing and def was always anticipating the next episode.

Title: Monthly Magazine Home
Review: Has some really funny moments. Not my favorite leads. Pretty tropey but with some bright spots.

Title: Moving
Review: overall a really good fun drama. definitely grasped my attention from the beginning and was very bingable. it lost me a little bit in the middle with the flashback episodes but i loved the beginning episodes with the students. ending was a bit abrupt but felt like they might have laid the foundation for a second season.

Title: Mr. Plankton
Review: I had such high hopes for this drama but it was ultimately disappointing. I feel like im being gaslit or something bc everyone seems to love this show, but it was just too bizarre. on the one hand, i loved the male lead. he might just be the most attractive Korean actor I’ve ever seen. and his acting in this is well done. however, the other main leads are poorly cast. the female lead was the wrong choice, i found her very annoying and her acting one dimensional. i also was weirded out by the choice of second male lead. he is 12 years older than the female lead, which just felt unnecessary and weird. there were many unexplained, dumb, or strange plot points that i couldnt overlook and that kind of ruined the drama for me (for ex, how he takes her from her wedding against her will, how she is engaged to the SML after only 2 months, how she flip flops between the FL and SFL too much, the constant back and forth between the main couple and repeated conversations, the weird grooming relationship with the SFL, the confusing plot point with the ML’s half sister, etc). there were a few cute or emotional scenes that i did appreciate tho, and i was definitely crying at the end.

Title: Mr. Queen
Review: Super hilarious. FL is so good. Chemistry between leads is great. Plot doesn’t get boring. Great ensemble cast. One of the funniest kdramas I’ve watched

Title: Mr. Sunshine
Review: Am I glad I watched this? Yes. Would I watch again? No. Dragged in the middle and was just SO LONG but has good beginning and end. Could have been much shorter tho. Good history lesson.

Title: My Demon
Review: a bit of a rollercoaster of a drama (not in a good way lol). started off kinda boring but by episode 4-5 i was invested. the fake marriage plot was cute and there were some really funny memorable scenes like the tango scene and the two assistants out-clapping each other at the wedding. had some cute couple moments in the middle. villains/chaebol family played their roles well. but then the writing fell apart at the end. male lead sacrifices himself for the FL by bringing her back to life at the end of ep 15, only to then magically reappear 15 minutes into the final episode. also the villain fell from a skyscraper and was crushed under a chunk of ceiling and still didnt die…i also think madame ju got off too easy for basically causing dohee’s mother’s death. and ML didnt even turn into a human in the end?! despite some cute/good moments in the middle, the major plot holes at the end/the dumb ending definitely lower the rating of the drama overall. male and female leads are super pretty tho and had good chemistry.

Title: My Lovely Liar
Review: started off interesting and had some cute moments with the ML and FL. but the tone was weird - it went from heavy topics to cringey cuteness the next moment. it felt like the mystery and heavy topics (toxic mothers, suicide, abusive relationships etc) were not given proper serious attention. also, it was frustrating that they made the murderer be the gay friend who was in love with the ML. it made it feel like a kdrama from 2016, not one from 2023. also, the ML and FL could also be quite boring at times and had limited expressions and acting range. side plots were not that interesting (ex: the parents, the business owners). overall it was avg to below avg. but the ML is pretty.

Title: My Man Is Cupid
Review: started off really cute. the male lead is super adorable and Nana is so beautiful. but then the plot got so consumed by the murder plot that the show lost me. i would have much preferred a cute romance centered on him being a cupid and her finding out, and on cute couples that he tries to set up with his powers. also the fact that the second reincarnation of the female lead was a high schooler/minor was a tad off-putting. and the second male lead was annoying and ugly so i was not invested in him as a character at all. had some very good kiss scenes tho! fast forwarded through the last two eps.

Title: My Mister
Review: So quietly and painfully tragic. Really hits the feels. Such a good story. A different kind of love story. Acting is amazing. Just a fantastically done show.

Title: My Name
Review: This show is BADASS. It was 100% a binge watch. Ending with the ML being killed broke my heart. FL is a badass. Not the most original story but it’s super well done.

Title: My Roommate Is a Gumiho
Review: Overall a very cute, easy to watch drama. The first 6-7 episodes are especially adorable and swoon worthy. Also very funny and a good cast. Did slow down near the middle/end and in general the plot/writing was pretty cheesy, but it’s a fun drama that’s funny and light on melodrama. Good kiss scenes too. The age gap between the FL and ML is a bit much tho.

Title: My Sweet Mobster
Review: cute funny comedy. the male lead was surprisingly charming and had a nice husky voice. got kind of boring near the end. romance was a little too cutesy and boring compared to what i expect from kdramas nowadays — it felt more reminicsent of a 2016 drama. but some of the side characters had charm. the second male lead was super annoying though. kiss scenes were very lame too as they were basicallg just fish kisses.

Title: Mystic Pop-Up Bar
Review: After CLOY this is the next drama that made me fall in love with kdramas. It’s SO FUN with great acting, humor, plot, abs romance. Such a cute lil quirky show.

Title: No Gain, No Love
Review: very fun, cute drama. deals with a lot of progressive issues and is very sex positive. both the main and second couples are cute and have good chemistry, though more focus is given to the second couple near the end. a few plot lines are rushed near the end and i actually think this could have benefitted from 16 episodes instead of 12. the scene where the second male lead apprehends the murderer with sex toys will definitely go down in kdrama history.

Title: Not Others
Review: a pretty progressive drama feat. topics like teen pregnancy, sex positive, sex toys, masturbation, chosen family, a gay couple, etc. had some funny moments, but the mystery was very obvious from the beginning and dragged on, plus the mother-daughter could be kind of annoying and toxic at times. the daughter’s love interest was cute, but i wanted more relationship moments.

Title: Oh My Venus
Review: Pretty fat phobic but has some funny parts and and okay romance. It’s a light watch.

Title: Once Upon a Small Town
Review: Super cute. Romance was very heart fluttering. Funny moments too. Short and sweet.

Title: One Spring Night
Review: Can’t say I remember much from this show other than jung Hae in is adorable and so is his son. FL is boring. Overall not memorable but I was able to watch the whole thing (I think)

Title: Our Beloved Summer
Review: This drama is way overhyped. I obvi love V’s song for the OST tho. Wooshik’s acting is great and I found the ML so adorable. Some cute couple moments. But I didn’t really care about any of the side characters (tho I did like the manager and friend) and the love triangles felt so unnecessary. Fast forwarded through a lot the last three episodes. Felt like it should have been 12 episodes. The part where the ML admitted he was abandoned by his dad as a kid was really moving tho.

Title: Queen of Tears
Review: this show started off funny and interesting and it was fun to see the couple rekindle their relationship. but then in the middle it got really stupid. the whole plot and the character’s actions were motivated by their pride and inability to communicate and the main female lead was so boring. i fast forwarded a lot of the middle parts just to see what happened in the end. the plot was long and convoluted and the show bounced between comedy and drama and sadness in a very jarring way. i just wasn’t invested in the love story. a very overhyped drama.

Title: Reborn Rich
Review: this drama was super engaging and bingeable . Love a good revenge plot. The ending was not the best - it was satisfying in that he got his revenge but not satisfying in that it was due to a bunch of plot holes. Him being the one who killed Do Jun and having evidence all along but then not knowing he killed Do Jun or that Do Jun died when he becomes Do Jun didn’t make sense…also wish the ML had a real outburst at the end. He was the same level of energy for nearly the whole thing. still a good watch tho.

Title: Record of Youth
Review: Boring. No chemistry with the leads. Annoying mom. Dumb/no plot. But it’s got pretty people in it

Title: Romance Is a Bonus Book
Review: Unexpectedly cute and heartwarming office romcom. Both male leads are cute and likable and so is the unconventional FL. Also the second couple/side characters are hilarious.

Title: Rookie Cops
Review: The romance in this was unexpectedly cute and I also got unexpectedly sad when they killed off a main character. But struggled narratively in some parts.

Title: Run On
Review: this was a drama i initially dropped when it came out in 2020/2021 and returned to years later. i remember initially thinking it was boring but upon returning to it, i love that it was so character driven and wasnt tropey. it was a surprisingly progressive drama: the male lead is a bit socially awkward and possibly on the spectrum, the female lead is very outspoken and independent, there are several gay characters and an asexual character, a femae boxer, and a divorce plot. i also liked how mature the relationships were, but they were also quite cute, but not in an infantilizing way. i liked both couples’ chemistry. the story got a little boring towards the end and the finale felt kind of rushed, but overall a nice watch.

Title: See You in My 19th Life
Review: started off interesting and fun but got boring. did have a cute ending though with her forgetting her 19 lives and the ML and her sister remembering her.

Title: Semantic Error
Review: Good chemistry between the leads and quite steamy at times/good sexual tension. Cute opposites attract slash enemies to lovers story.

Title: Serendipity's Embrace
Review: cute, but average romance with some bright spots but nothing too standout. the main leads are cute, as were the second couple. its only 8 episodes so there really wasnt much development or plot, but it was an easy watch. had a nice soundtrack.

Title: Sh**ting Stars
Review: Had some cute and funny eps in the beginning but then just got boring and dumb. Too many characters. Main couple and actor couple had some cute moments tho. Promising but just ended up being avg.

Title: She Would Never Know
Review: Started off really weird but interesting and then became a super sweet romance. Rowoon was adorable and the kiss scenes were quality. I liked the gay plot line too - it was handled very well in the end. Did not care at all about the side couples with the chairman and rowoon’s sister and the director and the chairman’s sister. I fast forwarded through those scenes. Eventually the plot slowed and the breakup felt like filler. Cute ending though.

Title: Shopping King Louie
Review: Watched this on a total whim and was rewarded. It’s hilarious and has some really cute moments with the main couple. ML has great acting. Fun, easy  watch.

Title: Snowdrop
Review: Although some parts dragged like the ones with the wives and some of the characters were so annoying like Bun-Ok and the evil guys, this show made me CRY so much in the finale and the acting was so good. Some of the twists at the end felt like they could have been hinted more and felt a bit random. But damn jung hae in is AMAZING in this and jisoo does well too. Second ML and FL are both bad asses. Really good drama despite the controversy surrounding it. Jung hae in’s eyes kill me the guy knows how to act!! OST was also beautiful and it was beautifully shot as well.

Title: Something in the Rain
Review: Sigh. I have so many opinions about this drama. The first 8 episodes are arguably the BEST romance I’ve ever seen in a kdrama. It’s so unconventional, interesting, real, adorable, and sexy. But episode 9 it all goes downhill. The characters make super annoying choices and the plot suffers from “lack of communication” kdrama trope. The FL’s mom is just AWFUL. The breakup was so annoying and frustrating that I didn’t even care about the ending at all. Ugh, this drama took me so high and then just ended so low.

Title: Soundtrack #1
Review: Short and cute. Leads have decent chemistry but it’s not like off the charts. Happy cute ending. Wish there had been more cute moments.

Title: Spice up Our Love
Review: I was so excited for this spin off because I loved No Gain No Love and really liked the second couple in it, but this was such a disappointment. I thought it would start after No Gain No Love ended and continue the second couple’s relationship so we could see more of their development, but instead the plot started before they got together so it was far less satisfying and lost a lot of the charm and chemistry that No Gain No Love had. The fantasy mechanics of the plot were also poorly written and it just fell flat overall. Such a letdown. It does have a good OST sung by the male lead though.

Title: Squid Game
Review: The hype is real, this show is great. It pulls you in and you just wanna binge and find out what happens. So many characters to love (and love to hate). Justice for Ali!!! Also SHOCKED that the detective died?? Ending was a bit random though, like this old guy is just rich and bored?? But I guess it was a comment on capitalism lol. Anyways, very well done overall. I think they’re doing a season 2 so that will be interesting.

Title: Squid Game Season 2
Review: Slow start but was still a fun watch with several surprising twists like when one of the characters featured turned out to be a masked guard not a player, and when player 001 turned out to be the frontman (the police officer’s brother). But it felt like half a season, not a full season, and lacked the punch and impact that season 1 had. I didn’t feel as emotionally invested in the characters as I was in season 1, with the exception of the transgender woman played by Park Sung Hoon, who was by far my favorite character. Its understandable that sequels are usually setup in a trilogy, but what started as a revenge plot ended up being a bit of a letdown because the main character Gihoon basically had no plan at all until the last episode where he suddenly gets a crew together to steal the guards’ guns, but it goes nowhere. Even if the frontman/player 001 hadn’t betrayed him and sabotaged the plan in the end, it probably wouldn’t have succeeded…so it feels like we’re back at square one with no plot movement at all, especially since the plotline with the police officer went nowhere the entire season. Overall, it just lacked a lot of the tension and dynamism of the previous season. But it was still entertaining enough to binge in 2 days.

Title: Start-Up
Review: A bit conflicted about this one. It starts off SO strong and it was some extremely hilarious moments and a great cast overall. But I got such intense SML syndrome that I wasn’t as engaged bc I knew the FL and ML would def end up together. The SML had such a better backstory and connection to the FL that it was disappointing for her to choose the ML…alas. Pretty solid overall. Worth a watch but idk about a rewatch.

Title: Strong Woman Do Bong Soon
Review: Cute. Main couple have a lot of chemistry. Cute happy ending. Awkwardly goes between very intense and very comedic too quickly. Pretty homophobic. Cute happy ending. Fast forwarded some parts. Some plot lines were dumb like with the fake Indian monk and the gay manager at work.

Title: Summer Strike
Review: Damn, this drama hit me in the feels. It was so beautifully done, from the acting to the OST to the character development. I didn’t love that it became a murder mystery but it was at least wrapped up nicely with ample time for an “epilogue.”  I wanted more romance (like just one more hug even?? lol) between the main leads, but it did make sense for their shy personalities and was still so sweet. And the real love story is Yeo Rum and Bom, their friendship and sisterly type love was so heartwarming and their chemistry as actors was so natural. Ah, I’m still teary eyed after that finale. Def a top drama for me for 2022. And so unexpected! I watched it on a whim and I’m so glad I did.

Title: Sweet Home
Review: very gory, but the characters are interesting. similar to happiness, especially the theme that the humans are scarier than the monsters. i think i liked happiness better though. but this was good enough to make me want to watch the second season.

Title: Taxi Driver
Review: Started off really strong. In later episodes, the plot drags a bit. Could have been 12 episodes and would’ve been better. Liked the ending with the prosecutor joining the rainbow taxi team tho. Will watch season 2.

Title: The Atypical Family
Review: Wow. What a gem of a show. The trailers didnt grab me initially when this came out but then i kept hearing good things about this drama and im so glad i decided to watch it. The male lead was so good at playing a depressed person and then it was such a joy to watch him become happy again, and he was equally good at playing both a clueless but earnest father trying his best and a hopeless romantic. the female lead was also great, and between this drama and be melodramatic she is shaping up to be one of my favorite korean actresses of all time. the writing and plot was so fun, refreshing, and original. I cried so many tears while watching this show. I loved the love story, it was a very cosmic one, what with the “my past is your future” threadline but it was also so full of cute little moments that felt real, and not forced or like fan service. I love when kdrama romances feel genuine, and arent overly chaste or infanfile, and this one was mature and intense without being overly melodramatic or over the too. Also loved all the wholesome dad-daughter moments. The mom and sister could be kind of annoying, but they good redemption arcs. There were some really emotional and well done moments related to weight and emotional eating that really hit home for me. My heart just felt so warm while watching this show. And then i was crying for the entire last 20 minutes of the finale. The ending of the male lead’s son having the super power of beinf able to retrieve lost things and bring back his dad was so sweet. That final moment when the leads reunite was precious. I wish there’d been more of a reunion, but the moment and the ending overall was well done. Also the OST and cinematography was very good. Overall just a fantastic show.

Title: The Fabulous
Review: Very cheesy, but had its cute moments. Good music and loved the fashion. Also love how lgbtq forward it was (by kdrama standards) with its openly gay character

Title: The Forbidden Marriage
Review: Started off strong, but then got serious and the FL lost all of her fun quirky personality. Also had major second male lead syndrome for the first half. Overall just okay.

Title: The Glory
Review: So brutal, the early scenes in the first few episodes had me bawling. Intriguing story, good acting. Love Ms Kang and her relationship with the FL. ML turning out to be a little messed up himself was a good plot twist. Looking forward to the second season and seeing how this story ends.

Title: The Glory Part 2
Review: Such a satisfying ending to see all the terrible people get their just desserts, especially the main bully. Glad it was a happy ending for the main lead and her helpers. I liked the twist at the end of the MLs mom asking the FL to save her son by helping execute his revenge. Liked the motif of the FL not giving in to suicide because she saves others. Overall really good ending to a tragic story. Great revenge plot.

Title: The Good Bad Mother
Review: Really good drama. You love to hate the mom and eventually you love to love the mom. ML’s acting is so good. Very endearing ensemble cast. Tear jerking ending but also satisfying. And the two kids are so cute. Good well rounded drama.

Title: The Heirs
Review: It’s been like 10+ years since I watched this drama…I imagine it would be HELLA cheesy if I rewatched other and probably doesn’t age super well lol. But at the time I remember liking the SML a lot.

Title: The Judge from Hell
Review:
A pretty interesting drama. It’s an enemy to lovers story with a twist. The twist being that they are actually legitimate enemies: her a corrupt judge who gives murderers light sentences and him a homicide detective who wants to put the murderers in prison. The next twist is that she’s actually a demon who has to kill the murderers and send them to hell, which is why she needs to let them off easy in court. I liked the creative way the show called attention to corruption in the justice system while also developing the cat and mouse game between the two leads for the first half of the show.

But in the later episodes — after the fake out of the male lead dying — it lost me. There were a lot of plot holes and loose ends, and what chemistry the two leads had at the beginning with the enemies tension was totally gone by the end. Overall it was still a fun show, but I dont think it was amazing as some people made it out to be.

Title: The King's Affection
Review: Great acting, solid plot, cute romance, could be slightly boring at times but overall good pacing. Fun twist to a historical drama. Rowoon is great. As usual.

Title: The Law Cafe
Review: Very melodramatic at times but also has cute romance, cute characters, and a lot of sex positivity!

Title: The Matchmakers
Review:
Such a good comedy historical drama. Rowoon is hilarious, the female lead is gorgeous, and the ensemble cast is
A++. Very well rounded drama with comedy, political plot that kept me guessing, and cute romance. especially loved the old maidens and their couples. made me LOL and also swoon. rowoon keeps getting better in every drama of his i watch. would have liked a bit more time with the happy couple at the end but at least it was a happy ending so cant complain. also, cinematography and music was perfecf.

Title: The Red Sleeve
Review: It’s hard to describe my feelings after this drama. The show was so tragic. It was so hard to see the FL give up her freedom in exchange for love when the king could not fully love her. Then again he chose in the end to be with her in death for eternity rather than continue living as king. I agree that it would have been satisfying to have an ending where she is free and with her friends but somehow this ending feels more complex - she did love him as a person but not as the king and in the end he chose her over being the king but only could in death bc he was trapped just as much as she was. DAMN. Just so complex and so many emotions. Junho is AMAZING and the first half of this show is so pure and great before all the tragedy sinks in. Best historical drama I’ve ever watched. Rated it higher after watching the behind the scenes bc the cast has so much chemistry and I love it.

Title: The Story of Park's Marriage Contract
Review: started off SO STRONG but then kind of lost me at the end. the twist of the grandpa being the real villain was kinda good, but then the random guy who had a grudge against the grandpa was so unnecessary and not fleshed out enough. MLs had great chemistry and theres lots of good kiss and cute couple scenes. the second couple/sidekicks are also good. some characters like the aunt felt entirely unnecessary. feel like it would have been stronger if it had been 14 or 16 episodes, but still overall a fun and bingeable watch.

Title: Thirty but Seventeen
Review: An older drama that can be a bit cheesy but is over a super solid. Funny, cute romance, great cast, interesting plot (tho a bit tropey). This FL is great in everything I’ve seen her in. ML is forgettable and not that cute but their chemistry worked. Ahn  Hyeoseop is in it and he’s super young but MAN does he look different than he does in a business proposal lol.

Title: To My Star
Review: Cute but way too short. Wanted more cute couple moments. Love the bed kiss scene at the end tho - was def less chaste than other bl dramas I’ve seen so far.

Title: Tomorrow with You
Review: Plot dragged a little and could be kind of convoluted but was also interesting and did keep you guessing. Chemistry is great and the relationship is very realistic. Good mix of scifi, romance, and suspense. Overall a good watch.

Title: Touch Your Heart
Review: Super cute, fairly uncomplicated romcom. Cute pairing of the leads and good chemistry. Funny ensemble cast - loved the other lawyers in the firm.

Title: True Beauty
Review: Finally a drama where I actually LIKED the love triangle and both male leads!! Acting was great and the cast is so funny. Loved the music too. Nothing too deep here but just such a fun and cute drama. Best high school drama I’ve watched

Title: True to Love
Review: this started promising. the concept was interesting, and the first few episodes were a bit slow but decent. but then it got boring. then it picked up again in the middle and had some cute moments with the main couple. the ML is so cute (esp when he smiles) so i was pretty invested for a bit but then they did the whole miscommunication trope that annoyed me. it took a million eps for the leads to confess to liking each other which was just frustrating. also all the side couples were weird. the married couple was boring and felt like an odd match. the boss and the girl at work had a big age difference that felt a bit creepy. the sister seemed to be in her early or mid twenties but acted and was treated like a child, and her boyf was low key a bit stalkery at first. also he was not cute and their relationship was not that deep yet ended in a pregnancy and marriage which was weird. overall a below avg drama with a few bright spots.

Title: Twenty-Five Twenty-One
Review: Would have been a 10/10 drama if not for the ending. The breakup didn’t make sense for their characters. They were such a unique and strong couple out of any kdrama I’d ever seen and then to have them break up just bc of long distance fell completely flat. Side characters in this show are amazing I loved them all. Also the music and costumes were great.

Title: Twinkling Watermelon
Review: extremely wholesome. a drama that pulls you in and gives you all the feels. good ensemble cast. funny. male leads are cute. heartwarming plot. nice ending. an all rounder. love the spotlight it shines on the deaf community and accessibility. actors are all really good.

Title: Vincenzo
Review: SO GOOD. This drama has everything - romance, action, mystery, humor, great acting. Leads are AMAZING, actually the whole cast is. Can’t believe I dropped it on first watch bc I ended up loving it.

Title: Weightlifting Fairy Kim Bok Joo
Review: SO CUTE! chemistry among the leads is so good. Great soundtrack, good cast, perfect friends to dating romance. So funny too. Didn’t love the fatshaming tho

Title: What Comes after Love
Review:
This is first and foremost a breakup story, rather than a romance, though it does have a happy ending even though its open-ended. It starts off very fun and cute and then very quickly veers into
melodrama territory, but the pacing is to be expected since its such a short miniseries. As annoying as the main couple’s miscommunication is at times, I do think their struggles were kind of realistic and relatable. I also liked that this story shows an international and cross-cultural couple; I think this is the first kdrama I’ve watched that features this as the main couple. I didn’t love it overall, but it was cool to see the juxtaposition of Japanese and Korean culture and language, and I was very impressed by the main actress’s Japanese. I also loved the scene where they have an argument and she defaults to yelling in Korean, even though he doesn’t understand. That was very powerful to watch and her acting was A+.

Title: When the Camellia Blooms
Review: ML is cute but FL is boring.  Mystery is kind of interesting but the rest is boring. Pretty subpar overall but was compelling enough to keep watching tho I did watch it early on in my kdrama journey

Title: When the Phone Rings
Review: might be the only drama where ive rewatched episodes while waiting for the new episodes to drop. strong urge to rewatch episode as soon as i finish it. the scenes with the main couple are just so captivating. its definitely an over the top soapy type of drama but i loved it. the hype is real. also had some of the best kdrama kiss scenes (including one of the best kdrama kisses of the decade in episode 7 — dripping with passion fr fr). the last few episodes had a bit too much back and forth of the main leads ending up in the hospital and overall I liked the first half of the series better. there are definitely some plot holes and the final episode is pretty bad. the part in the finale with the fictional war torn country Argan was also ABSURD and totall unnecessary. despite these flaws, the compelling plot and off the charts chemistry make this a very fun drama. It’s tropey but its really well done for this type of drama.

Title: When the Weather Is Fine
Review: Slow and sweet romance. Interesting family dynamics. Book club is cute. Warm and cozy feel to this drama but it wasn’t like an absolute standout

Title: Where Stars Land
Review: I liked the airport slice of life aspect but didn’t love the backstory of the ML. Very melodramatic at times. Really liked the second couple. Also Rowoon is in it so duh.

Title: Where Your Eyes Linger
Review: Very low budget short miniseries. One of the MLs is super attractive. Cute at times but just okay.

Title: You're Beautiful
Review: Watched this so long ago so don’t remember it perfectly. Generally a pretty tropey drama but cute. Wonder if it ages well tho

Title: Youth of May
Review: I cried so much, two amazing leads with great chemistry, such a sad love story

Title: Yumi's Cells
Review: Started off really promising and I liked the first few eps but Yumi has like zero personality. Characters were too immature. The animation was cute for a while but got old
